alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 3:20PM CDT until June 19 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR MAGNOLIA SPRINGS, FOLEY, THEODORE, AND IRVINGTON... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN BALDWIN AND SOUTHWESTERN MOBILE COUNTIES... At 320 PM CDT, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 8 and 13 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. A foot and a half of water over Highway 98 in and around Magnolia Springs. Automated rain gauges have measured upwards of 12 inches of rain in the area. Vehicle rescues have been reported in Foley. Water has been reported entering buildings on Dauphin Island Parkway. US 90 near Alabama 16 and McDonald Road closed in both directions. Numerous roads are reported impassable in southern Mobile County. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Magnolia Springs, Foley, Theodore, and Irvington. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Foley, Theodore, Point Clear, Magnolia Springs, Bon Secour, Battles Wharf, Barnwell, Faustinas, Mon Louis, Sunny Cove, Smithport, Bayleys Corner, Turkey Branch, Belle Fontaine, River Park, Delchamps, South Orchard, Marlow, Fowl River and Kirewakra. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
